question:
The Abdul Kalam Island has been in news recently. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. It is located in the Arabian Sea.
  2. It is the location of a missile testing site.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The Abdul Kalam Island is located in the Bay of Bengal. Previously known as Wheeler Island, it was renamed in honour of the former president in 2015. It is located off the shore of Odisha. It is located close to the Gahirmatha Marine Sanctuary of Odisha.  Statement 2 is correct: The Abdul Kalam Island houses Integrated Test Range for testing missiles. It is a facility under DRDO. The Odisha government allotted the island to DRDO in 1993. Most of India’s missiles are tested here. Recently, the first night-time testing of Agni-II was conducted here.
